SEARCH
Package photos.controller

Class PhotosController

java.lang.Object
photos.controller.PhotosController
public class PhotosController extends Object
Controller for the login, admin, and stock pages of the Photos application. Handles user login routing and admin user management, and navigation to stock and user pages. Authored by Chloe Wolohan.

  • Method Details

    • goToApplication

      public void goToApplication(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handles the login logic and routes users to to the appropriate interface (admin, stock, or normal home page) depending on input.
      Parameters:
      e - is the triggering event from the login button.

    • quitApplication

      public void quitApplication(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Saves all user data and exits the application cleanly.
      Parameters:
      e - is the triggering event from the quitButton button.

    • returnLog

      public void returnLog(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Returns from the current view to the login page.
      Parameters:
      e - is the triggering event.

    • displayAllUsers

      public void displayAllUsers(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Displays all users in a modal ListView via the Display.fxml view. It is only accessible to the admin user.
      Parameters:
      e - is the triggering event from the displayAllUsers button

    • createUser

      public void createUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Creates a new user with the name entered in the associated text field. Only allowed for admin user. Ignores blank or duplicate names.
      Parameters:
      e - is the triggering event from the createUser button

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Deletes the user specified in the associated text field. Only allowed for admin user. Ignores blank or invalid names.
      Parameters:
      event - is the triggering event from the deleteUser button.

    • loadStockPage

      public void loadStockPage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      It loads the stock album page associated with the Stock.fxml view. Should be loaded from TrueStockPage.fxml
      Parameters:
      event - is the triggering event from the loadStockPage button
